## Joins

```{r}
products_popularity_txt <- "
SELECT op.product_id
,   n_orders
,   product_name
FROM (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   COUNT(1) AS n_orders
    FROM order_products__prior_tbl
    GROUP BY product_id
    ORDER BY n_orders DESC
    LIMIT 30) op
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   product_name
    FROM products_tbl) p
ON op.product_id = p.product_id
"

products_popularity <-
  dbGetQuery(sc, products_popularity_txt)

products_popularity
```

```{r}

products_popularity %>%
  ggplot(
    aes(reorder(product_name, n_orders, function(x) x), 
        n_orders)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity", fill='darkorange') +
  coord_flip() + 
  scale_y_continuous(label=scales::comma) +
  xlab("product") +
  ylab("Number of orders") +
  theme_minimal()
```

```{r}
products_popularity_txt <- "
SELECT op.product_id
,   n_orders
,   product_name
FROM (

LEFT JOIN (

ON op.product_id = p.product_id
"

products_popularity <-

products_popularity
```

* The most reordered products?
```{r}
products_reorded_txt <- "
SELECT op.product_id
,   n_reorders
,   product_name
FROM (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   sum(reordered) AS n_reorders
    FROM order_products__prior_tbl
    GROUP BY product_id
    ORDER BY n_reorders DESC
    LIMIT 30) op
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   product_name
    FROM products_tbl) p
ON op.product_id = p.product_id
"

products_reorded <-
  dbGetQuery(sc, products_reorded_txt)

products_reorded
```

* The less reorderd product?

```{r}
products_reorded_txt <- "
SELECT op.product_id
,   n_reorders
,   product_name
FROM (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   sum(reordered) AS n_reorders
    FROM order_products__prior_tbl
    GROUP BY product_id
    ORDER BY n_reorders
    ) op
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   product_name
    FROM products_tbl) p
ON op.product_id = p.product_id
where n_reorders!=0
limit 30
"

products_reorded_txt <- "
SELECT op.product_id
,   n_reorders
,   product_name
FROM (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   sum(reordered) AS n_reorders
    FROM order_products__prior_tbl
    where reordered!=0
    GROUP BY product_id
    ORDER BY n_reorders
    limit 30
    ) op
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   product_name
    FROM products_tbl) p
ON op.product_id = p.product_id
"

products_reorded <-
  dbGetQuery(sc, products_reorded_txt)

products_reorded
```

```{r}
 from (SELECT order_id,  count(1) as n_products
    FROM order_products__prior_tbl 
    group by order_id) op

```
```{r}
breakint=5
order_products__prior%>% 
  group_by(order_id) %>%
  summarise(n_products=n()) %>%
  group_by(breakprod=breakint*floor(n_products%/%breakint))%>%
  summarise(n_orders=n()) %>%
  filter(breakprod<=50) %>% collect %>%
  ggplot(aes(breakprod,n_orders)) +
  geom_col(fill="darkorange")+
  theme_minimal()
  
```

## Whisker, magrittr
```{r}
name<-"Bartek"
paste0("My name is",name,".")
whisker
data<-list(name="Bartek")
whisker.render("My name is {{name}}.",data)
```

```{r}
library(whisker)
library(magrittr)

product_times_ordered_txt <- "
SELECT n_orders
,   COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS n_users
FROM (
    SELECT o.user_id
    ,   COUNT(DISTINCT op.order_id) AS n_orders
    FROM (
        SELECT order_id
        FROM order_products__prior_tbl
        WHERE product_id = {{productId}}
    ) op
    LEFT JOIN (
        SELECT  user_id
        ,   order_id
        FROM orders_tbl) o
    ON op.order_id = o.order_id
    GROUP BY o.user_id) opo
GROUP BY n_orders
ORDER BY n_orders
"

data <- list(productId = 24852)

product_times_ordered_txt %>%
  whisker.render(data) %>%
  cat
```
```{r}
product_times_ordered_txt %>%
  whisker.render(data) %>%
  dbGetQuery(sc, .) %>%
  ggplot(aes(n_orders, n_users)) + 
  geom_line() +
  theme_minimal()
```

## Questions

#* For given department, plot the most popular product (with templating department).
* For given department, give a list of 10 the most popular product (with templating department).
```{r}
product_times_ordered_txt <- "
SELECT op.product_id, product_name
,  COUNT(1) as n_orders
FROM (
        SELECT product_id
        FROM order_products__prior_tbl
    ) op
left JOIN (
        SELECT  product_name
        ,   product_id
        ,   department_id
        FROM products_tbl) p
ON op.product_id = p.product_id
WHERE department_id = {{departmentId}}
GROUP BY op.product_id, product_name
ORDER BY n_orders desc
"
data <- list(departmentId = 19)
product_times_ordered_txt %>%
  whisker.render(data) %>%
  dbGetQuery(sc, .) 
```

```{r}
")
```
```{r}
#
dbGetQuery(sc, 
"SELECT user_id
,   order_id
,   FIRST_VALUE(order_id)  OVER(partition by user_id ORDER BY order_number) AS first_order
FROM orders_tbl
WHERE user_id <= 10 
")
```
* Product that is usually orders in numerous baskets

```{r}
"
SELECT product_id
,   AVG(products_number) AS avg_products_number
FROM (
    SELECT order_id
    ,   product_id
    ,   COUNT(product_id)  OVER(partition by order_id) AS products_number
    FROM order_products__train_tbl
) pn
GROUP BY product_id
ORDER BY avg_products_number DESC
LIMIT 100
" %>%
dbGetQuery(sc, .)
```

* Could modify the query and add prduct name?

```{r}
"
SELECT op1.product_id
,  avg_products_number, p.product_name
From(select product_id
,   AVG(products_number) AS avg_products_number
FROM (
    SELECT order_id
    ,   product_id
    ,   COUNT(product_id)  OVER(partition by order_id) AS products_number
    FROM order_products__train_tbl
) pn 
GROUP BY product_id
ORDER BY avg_products_number DESC) op1 
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT product_id
    ,   product_name
    FROM products_tbl) p
ON op1.product_id = p.product_id


" %>%
dbGetQuery(sc, .)
```

*for 10 first users and all their orders find days since first order
google :hive window funciton
```{r}
# dbGetQuery(sc, 
# "
# SELECT  user_id
# ,   order_id
# ,   IF( first_order IS NULL, 0,  first_order) AS days_since_first_order
# FROM
# (SELECT user_id
# ,   order_id
# , sum(days_since_prior_order) OVER(partition by user_id ORDER BY order_number) AS first_order
# FROM orders_tbl
# WHERE user_id <= 10 ) aaa
# ORDER BY USER_ID
# ")

dbGetQuery(sc, 
"
SELECT user_id
,   order_number, days_since_prior_order
, COALESCE(sum(days_since_prior_order) OVER(partition by user_id ORDER BY order_number ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) ,0) AS day_since_first_order
FROM orders_tbl
WHERE user_id <= 10 
ORDER BY USER_ID, order_number
")
```



```{r}
orders %>%
  filter(user_id <= 10) %>%
  select(user_id, order_number, days_since_prior_order) %>%
  arrange(user_id, order_number) %>%
  mutate(days_since_first_order = cumsum(days_since_prior_order)) %>%
  mutate(days_since_first_order=ifelse(is.null(days_since_prior_order), 0, days_since_first_order))
```
